publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1266# Andrew Wilson: OKI, Cumbernauld—That the Parliament notes with regret the recent job losses at the OKI electronic equipment plant in Cumbernauld which were a direct result of the high value of the pound and the failure of the UK to join the European Single Currency; congratulates the workforce of OKI on their excellent record of productivity and efficiency, and calls for all possible action to be taken by the UK Government to bring down the damagingly high rate of the pound and end the continuing harm that Scotland’s non-membership of the Euro is doing to Scottish jobs particularly in Scotland’s trading sector.
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Brian Adam*
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Colin Campbell*, Fiona McLeod*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Margaret Smith*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Roseanna Cunningham*

S1M-1266# Andrew Wilson: OKI, Cumbernauld—That the Parliament notes with regret the recent job losses at the OKI electronic equipment plant in Cumbernauld which were a direct result of the high value of the pound and the failure of the UK to join the European Single Currency; congratulates the workforce of OKI on their excellent record of productivity and efficiency, and calls for all possible action to be taken by the UK Government to bring down the damagingly high rate of the pound and end the continuing harm that Scotland’s non-membership of the Euro is doing to Scottish jobs particularly in Scotland’s trading sector. Supported by: Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Colin Campbell, Fiona McLeod, Shona Robison, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Roseanna Cunningham, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Michael Russell*
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-1266# Andrew Wilson: OKI, Cumbernauld—That the Parliament notes with regret the recent job losses at the OKI electronic equipment plant in Cumbernauld which were a direct result of the high value of the pound and the failure of the UK to join the European Single Currency; congratulates the workforce of OKI on their excellent record of productivity and efficiency, and calls for all possible action to be taken by the UK Government to bring down the damagingly high rate of the pound and end the continuing harm that Scotland’s non-membership of the Euro is doing to Scottish jobs particularly in Scotland’s trading sector. Supported by: Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Colin Campbell, Fiona McLeod, Shona Robison, Margaret Smith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Roseanna Cunningham, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1266# OKI, Cumbernauld (lodged on 20 October 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
